ai.summary: Avalon Hide Path is a very short, easy hike in the UK, running about 0.4 km. It offers a gentle stroll suitable for beginners and families, with a quiet, nature-filled atmosphere.
ai.terrain_summary: A short, mostly flat route with a well-trodden surface. Expect grassy patches, compact soil, and a few exposed roots; it can be muddy in wet weather. Overall easy for most walkers.
ai.safety_notes: Despite its short length, follow standard UK trail safety: stay on the marked path, wear sturdy footwear, and be prepared for sudden weather changes. The trail may be shared with cyclists or other walkers on narrow sections. Bring water, dress for rain, and supervise children closely. In icy or high-wind conditions, consider postponing the hike.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or lightweight hiking boots
Weather-appropriate clothing (layered, including a waterproof jacket)
Sun protection (hat and sunscreen) or warm hat depending on season
Phone with map or offline navigation
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with the best conditions typically from late spring to early autumn.
